title: Jonna rottellu / Jowar flour roti’s 😊 Gluten free | Vegan 🌱
content:
Breakfast recipe: Jonna rottellu  Servings: 6 roti’s  A fulfilling, healthy and delicious sorghum flour roti’s can made instantly with freshly chopped veggies and grated bottle Gourd. Both accompanied very well and enriched the dish, I have also added Ajwain, cumin and sesame seeds to enhance the flavor in roti. This is one the easiest recipe with wholesome goodness, homemade, gluten free, vegan and also you can checkout Jowar health benefits below. Try this nutritionist breakfast, I’m sure you like it 😍 Health benefits of Jowar / sorghum flour:
  • Improves digestion
  • Boosts immunity
  • It is gluten free
  • Rich source of protein
  • Controls blood sugar level
  • High of fibre
  • Helps weight loss
  • Packed with essential Minerals and Vitamins
  • Good for Diabetics
Let’s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Duration: 30 minutes  Ingredients:
  • Jowar flour / sorghum flour - 240 grams
  • Hot Water ( Boiled) - 1/2 cup - 120 ml
  • Salt - 3/4 teaspoon
  • Green chillies - 4 - finely chopped
  • Ajwain / vaamu - 1/4 teaspoon
  • Cumin/ Jeera seeds - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Sesame seeds ( White ) - 1 teaspoon
  • Cilantro - 1/4 cup chopped
  • Carrot - grated - 1/4 cup
  • Bottled Gourd- Peeled off & grated - 1/2 cup
  • White onion - chopped - 1/3 cup
  • Coconut oil - To cook roti’s - 1 tb sp
Procedure:
  • In a wide bowl add flour, chopped & grated veggies , chillies, salt, cumin, Ajwain, sesame seeds
  • First, dry mix all ingredients and then add water then mix with a spoon or spatula because we are using hot water
  • Form a dough and divide it into 6 equal portions
  • Heat a tava on medium heat and make roti by applying oil on butter paper or on paper banana leaf
  • Tap the dough on sheet, make into round by dipping fingers in water( as shown in below pictures)
  • Add oil on tava and flip the sheet on it, let it sit for about half minute and gently remove sheet on tava, repeat the process to make other roti’s
  • Cook both sides by adding oil and till you see brown spots on it
  • It pairs with raw onion or pickle or curd and cucumber
  • Happy Cooking and Have a good day 🙂
